attributes.text: It's normal for your thoughts to wander. Simply try to take a step back and appreciate having a little Headspace.
attributes.title: User Statistics Card

attributes.text: Hey there, welcome to Headspace.
attributes.title: Welcome to Headspace.

attributes.text: It’s okay if you’ve never meditated before.
attributes.title: ImageThenText2

attributes.text: In fact, we made a quick video to help you learn the basics.
attributes.title: Video3

attributes.text: We’ll show you how to train your mind for a happier, healthier life.
Now, get ready to sit back and enjoy a little Headspace.
attributes.title: ImageThenText5

attributes.text: We’ll guide you through each step.
Meditation isn't about getting rid of your thoughts. It's about learning how to be at ease with them.
attributes.title: User Statistics Card

attributes.text: You've probably realized that meditation isn't about stopping your thoughts.
It takes practice to improve.
It's more like a skill.
All you need to do is set aside a little time each day.
And you'll feel more comfortable with your mind in no time.
What is important is how we relate to our thoughts and how we acknowledge becoming distracted by them.
attributes.title: User Statistics Card

attributes.text: Meditation isn't quite what people imagine it to be.
It's about changing your relationship with thoughts and feelings.
And learning to view them with perspective.
But that's okay. It just takes practice.
You'll occasionally get distracted and forget.
This video talks about it in a little more detail.
Pause for a moment to notice how you feel right now.
attributes.title: User Statistics Card

attributes.text: Meditating consistently can be difficult.
But there are ways to make it easier.
Try to anchor your practice to another part of your routine.
Like brushing your teeth.
Wake up and think: brush teeth, meditate, shower.
The idea of effort is a bit weird when you meditate.
Meditation is about letting go, not trying, not doing anything in fact.
So, for today's session, don't worry about achieving anything.
Just sit back and enjoy being present in the world.
This video might help.
Try not to overthink the process too much. Instead, enjoy the feeling of pausing to balance and catch your breath.
Did you uncover some tension? Or maybe you found yourself relaxed already? Remember, neither is right or wrong.
attributes.title: User Statistics Card

attributes.text: Unpleasant sensations can happen.
Maybe you've got an itch or some anxiety or even some discomfort.
Rather than running away from them.
Allow them to arise and be curious instead.
They'll help you get to know your mind a little better.
There's always a chance of clouds, but the idea of the blue sky will help things feel a little bit lighter.
attributes.title: User Statistics Card

attributes.text: Seeing your mind clearly is useful.
It can help you respond more skillfully to difficult situations.
And it can help you find another place in your mind.
A place of calm that's always there.
This video explains a little more about it.
Consider the emotional quality of your mind today. Remember there is no right or wrong.
attributes.title: User Statistics Card

attributes.text: Have you noticed anything new since you started meditating?
Maybe you're a little more attentive to thoughts.
Or a bit more conscious of your emotions.
That awareness helps us begin to better understand the mind.
And, as a result, we start to experience an entirely new perspective.
No matter how much you might want the mind to be free from thoughts, resisting them only creates tension.
attributes.title: User Statistics Card

attributes.text: The mind can be a weird place.
Accepting what comes and goes takes practice.
But doing so can help us be less judgmental.
Not just of ourselves but of others too.
So we become more at ease with the world around us.
This video talks about it in more detail.
There's so much to discover and explore with the mind.
attributes.title: User Statistics Card

attributes.text: You've done great making it to the last day of the Basics.
So great, in fact, that meditation might have already changed your brain.
Through neuroplasticity, your brain creates new neural pathways.
Every time you meditate, you make it a little easier to process thoughts and emotions.
So don't worry if there are still lots of thoughts running around.
That's perfectly normal at this stage.
Just keep practicing.
Each day is a new opportunity to train your mind for a happier, healthier life.
